articles.name: Email Alerts for Question Leakage
articles.title: Email Alerts for Question Leakage
articles.body:
Overview

Maintaining the integrity of coding assessments is crucial for fair and effective hiring. To enhance our commitment to secure testing, we are introducing Email Alerts for Question Leakage. This feature ensures that our customers can address leaked assessment questions immediately, preserving the quality and reliability of their hiring process.

Note: Currently this is an opt-in feature, you can reach out to support@hackerrank.com or your account manager to enable this. 

Benefits of Email Alerts for Question Leakage

  • Timely Notifications: Get alerted about leaked questions in your test, allowing for swift action.
  • Manage your inbox: Get alerted only for the tests that you subscribe to for leakage alerts. You also get to choose the cadence at which it is delivered to your inbox.
  • Streamlined leakage Management: Direct links in the emails take you to the test platform for immediate question replacement.

Enabling Email Alerts

For a Specific Test

  1. Navigate to the Settings tab of your desired test.
  2. Click on Emails in the left-hand menu.
  3. Under Leakage Alert Emails, select the users for whom you want to enable leakage alerts for.
  4. Save your changes.

For All Your Tests

  1. Go to User settings.
  2. Select Email notifications.
  3. Toggle on Send me an email if a question from tests that I manage leaks.
  4. Choose your preferred alert frequency: daily or weekly. (This is weekly by default)

For All Company Tests

  1. As an Admin, access the Company settings.
  2. Locate Test settings.
  3. Activate the Leaked Question Alerts toggle.
  4. Set the default alert cadence and save. 
  5. You can lock this setting to prevent individual overrides.

Receiving and Acting on Alerts

Upon activation, test editors will receive an email with:

  • A list of tests containing leaked questions.
  • Direct calls-to-action (CTAs) to manage each specific test.

Note: The list will have 2 kinds of leakages:

1) Questions that were not leakage protected and got leaked (marked without the shield icon)

2) Questions that were leakage protected but the automatic replacement failed (marked with the shield icon).

For viewing more than 3 tests, download the spreadsheet linked in the email to see all leaked questions across the tests you are monitoring.

 

With this feature, you can rest assured that the integrity of your assessments is vigilantly monitored. By enabling email alerts for question leakage, you can keep your hiring process secure and your assessments up to date, ensuring a fair evaluation of each candidate's skills.

For any further assistance or questions, write us at support@hackerrank.com.

articles.name: Flexible User Roles
articles.title: Flexible User Roles
articles.body:
Overview

HackerRank for Work (HRW) gives administrators complete control over user-level access with Flexible User Roles. It empowers the administrators with granular control over user entitlements within their organization.

Note: Currently this is an opt-in feature, you can reach out to support@hackerrank.com or your account manager to enable this. 

Introduction to Flexible User Roles

With the introduction of Flexible User Roles, administrators now have access to approximately 30 entitlements that they can adjust and combine to customize user roles and individual users within the HRW platform.

Entitlements

Entitlements are the building blocks that define what users can and cannot do within the HRW platform. They govern various actions, such as viewing, creating, updating, or deleting specific  tests, interviews, questions.

Advantages

This increased flexibility empowers administrators to:

  • Align User Roles with Workflows: Tailor user roles to match the exact responsibilities and processes within your organization, ensuring that each user has the right level of access and capabilities.
  • Granular Access Control: Precisely control users’ abilities, ensuring data protection and aligning to your security policies.
  • Adapt to Change: As your business processes evolve, you can easily adjust entitlements to accommodate new requirements or changing roles without disrupting operations.

With Flexible User Roles, you can shape the HackerRank platform experience to meet your organization's unique needs, enabling greater productivity, efficiency, and control.

Available Entitlements

Category Entitlement Definition
Tests View Tests Can view a test. Can view all questions within that test.
Send Test Invites Can invite candidates to a test. 
Edit Tests Can edit and share a test. Can only add/replace questions if they also have the View Question Library entitlement. 
Create Tests Can create a test. Can only add/replace questions if they also have the View Question Library entitlement.
View Test Insights Can view the Test Insights page.
View Test Reports Can view detailed test reports. Can view the candidate details from the “Tests” tab if they also have the View and Edit Candidates entitlement. 
Access All Tests Can perform any action on any test in the account, as if they were an Admin.
Interviews View Interviews Can view an interview’s details including the report, but without any scorecards.  
Create and Edit Interviews Can create an interview and add interviewers, tags and a candidate. Can only add an interview template if they also have the View Interview Templates entitlement.
Conduct Interviews Can join an interview if added as an interviewer. Can only see an assigned template if they also have the View Interview Templates entitlement.
Leave Feedback on Interviews Can add/edit their feedback for an interview they conducted. Can only see their own scorecard in the report.
View Full Interview Reports Can view all elements of a report, including feedback from all interviewers.
Access All Interviews Can perform any action on any interview in the account, as if they were an Admin.
Questions View Question Library Can view all questions in the HackerRank library and the Company Library.
Create and Edit Company Questions Can create, edit, and share company questions.
View Question Insights Can view the Question Insights page for Company questions and HRW library questions.
Access All Company Questions Can perform any action on any company question in the account, as if they were an Admin.
Interview Templates View Interview Templates Can view interview templates and all questions within that template. Can only add an interview template to an interview if they also have the Create and Edit Interviews entitlement.
Create and Edit Interview Templates Can create, edit, and share a template. Can only add/replace questions to their templates if they also have the View Question Library entitlement.
Access All Interview Templates Can perform any action on any template in the account, as if they were an Admin.
Candidates View and Edit Candidates Can view candidates on the Candidates page and within Tests, including their candidate packet.
Access All Candidates Can view all candidates in the account, as if they were an Admin.
Company Settings Create and Edit Teams:  Can create/edit/delete teams, manage members, set team admins, toggle library access, and set user allocation limits.
Modify Users Can lock users, change their user role, and override their individual entitlements. Can view quota limits. Can only add new users to the account and unlock users if they also have the Create and Edit Teams entitlement.
Modify User Role Entitlements Can change the default entitlements of any user role.
Modify Company Settings Can view and edit all company settings, including audit logs and integrations. Can also create, duplicate, and archive job roles.
View Company Insights Can view all company-level Insights dashboards.

 

Accessing Flexible Roles

To get started with Flexible Roles, navigate to the Teams Management section. From there, click on the User Roles tab. Now, you will have access to the user roles available in your account.  

Customizing User Roles 

As you visit the user roles page, you can select the role that you want to customize and use the toggle switch next to each entitlement to turn them on or off. Once done, click on the Save Changes button.  

Customizing Individual Users

  • Click on the users tab within the teams management page and select the desired user. 
  • A sliding window will appear with the user level information. From here visit the Entitlements section and use the toggle switches to customize the user based on your preferences.

Note: A user's entitlements are restricted by the maximum entitlements granted to their assigned user role. Users cannot exceed the limitations set for their role.

articles.name: Q1' 24 Release Notes
articles.title: Q1' 24 Release Notes
articles.body:
Prepare for an exciting leap forward with HackerRank's latest updates! Our committed team has been hard at work, delivering enhanced features and quick bug fixes to elevate your experience to new heights. Whether you're ready to push boundaries or need guidance through these enhancements, our stellar support team is here to assist you every step of the way. Just reach out to us at support@hackerrank.com, and let the journey begin!

Screen

Enhanced Test Creation Process

It’s now easier and faster for you to launch and maintain role-based assessments. With the new test creation experience, you can find and launch HackerRank’s recommended assessments in minutes, reduce the time you spend on test maintenance, and customize assessments to your unique needs.

What’s New? 

  • Find roles with our improved search experience
  • Replace leaked questions in a test with leakage-protected skill bundles
  • Customize sections with library questions and custom questions
  • Change your test’s duration
  • Reorder assessment sections

Learn more here.

New Database Question Creation UI

Assess candidates' database skills using improved database question creation workflow. 

What's New?

  • Ability to upload large CSV and schema files (up to 10MB)
  • Intuitive interface for creating database questions across MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MS SQL and DB2

Learn more here.

New Additions to Centralized Test Settings

Centralized test settings now allow you to set defaults for the following:

  • AI plagiarism detection 
  • Image analysis 
  • Email invitation subject line 
  • Confirmation email content  

You now have the ability to enforce these default values across all tests in your account.

Learn more here.

Updates to Summary Reports

The updated summary reports now offer enhanced readability and better responsiveness across all screen sizes.

What’s New? 

  • Proctoring images displayed with a player view, allowing you to expand and view each image individually.
  • Seek function within the player view for navigation through proctoring images.

  • Summary report can now be opened in a new tab. 

  • Improved responsiveness of the summary report

Learn more here.

Get Notified about Blocked Domains on IDE

Users will be notified proactively about blocked domains within the IDE environment. This feature provides clear identification of which domains need to be safelisted to ensure a seamless interaction with the IDE.

What’s New? 

  • Notifications for blocked domains encountered within the IDE across 
    • Screen
    • Question Creation
    • Reports
  • Clear identification of domains which need to be safelisted 

Learn more  here.

Network Indicator in IDE

Network indicator in the IDE alerts users of sub-optimal network conditions, empowering them to swiftly resolve connectivity issues. This ensures uninterrupted experiences during assessment, interviews and creating questions. 

Learn more here.

Network Indicator While Creating Questions

Network Indicator In Screen

Network Indicator in Reports

 

Reset Code to Previous Version

Elevate the candidate’s coding experience with the code reset option, empowering them to seamlessly revert to the initial state or navigate through different versions of their code.

What's New?

  • Easy code restoration to the initial state or previous versions
  • Efficient error recovery by reverting to an earlier working state
  • Track code revisions, evaluate scores, and select the perfect version for your candidate's success.

 

Copy-Paste Tracking for Sentence Completion and Subjective Questions

Monitor candidates' copy-pasting activities during assessments with our expanded copy-paste tracking capabilities.

Upgraded Bulk Upload Functionality for Multiple Choice and Sentence Completion Questions

New bulk upload features improve the creation process for MCQs and Sentence completion questions.

What's New?

  • Bulk upload Sentence Completion and MCQs in XLSX format
  • Ability to add images to Sentence Completion and MCQs using the XLSX format

Learn more here. 

Interviews

Protection of Candidate’s Information on Zoom

HackerRank ensures data confidentiality by encrypting and securely masking PII (Personally Identifiable Information) transmitted to Zoom. Users can now opt to have Interviewer and Candidate names masked in the Zoom video recordings. The candidate’s name is displayed as “Candidate” and Interviewer name is displayed as ‘Interviewer.’ Learn more.

Note: Interview recording is an opt-in feature. You can reach out to your account manager or HackerRank support (support@hackerrank.com) to enable it. 

VSCode Editor Updated to the Latest Version

VSCode has been updated to the latest version to leverage the latest VSCode features and extensions, such as the following:

  • Accessibility improvements: better screen reader support, keyboard shortcuts 
  • Terminal improvements: sticky scrolling
  • Extension compatibility: Gradle for Java
  • Layout configurability: Hide tab, maximize layout space, Multi-row editor tabs, multi-view layout resize

Compatibility Check for Interviews

Conduct a system compatibility check, assessing audio/video permissions, internet strength, and other key parameters. This proactive measure ensures a smooth experience for interviewers and candidates alike, allowing you to focus on the interview itself without technical disruptions.

Learn more here.

Admin

Flexible User Roles

This new capability allows admins to customize their user roles with entitlements suited to their organization's needs. Give each user the right level of access based on your organization's specific needs.

Note: This is an opt in feature. You can reach out to your account manager or HackerRank support (support@hackerrank.com) to enable it. 

What's New?

  • Modify User Roles: Admins can adjust up to 30 entitlements at the user role level, which will adjust the capabilities of all users with that user role.

  • Modify Individual Users: Admins can adjust those same entitlements on specific users, to further customize the capabilities beyond their user role definition

Learn more here.

Integrations

Improved Experience for Integration Settings Page

Manage and configure integrations with an improved user experience, focusing on usability and accessibility.

The new changes include:

  • Active integrations displayed more visibly

  • Significantly reduced page load times 
  • Logging for integration token generation and deletion

To get a feel of the new Integrations page for Lever (as an example), see the Lever Configuration guide.

New Questions Added  to the HackerRank Library

Job Family Skills Questions
AI & ML Databricks, Large Language Models, Prompt Engineering 20
Cloud Datadog 8
Cybersecurity Information Security, Network Security, Offensive Security, Security Testing Tools 102
Data Engineering Apache Spark, Databricks 30
Mobile Android (Kotlin), iOS 17
Software Engineering Problem Solving, Python 150
Web Development JavaScript, React 3

 

New Product: SkillUp

SkillUp assists organizations to mobilize their internal talent and future proof their technical teams by upskilling them to be GenAI ready. SkillUp comprises two main portals: Employee Portal and Employer Portal.

Learn more here.

Employee Portal:

  • Role Mastery Roadmap: Features competency radar for skill mapping and a curated Learning Plan for development.

  • Skills Directory: Catalogs 20 skills across various categories including AI & ML, Software Engineering, Cloud among others, with curated learning resources and AI support.

  • Roles Directory: Lists 19 roles across various categories including AI & ML, Software Engineering, Cloud among others, detailing pre-requisite skills, role readiness, and certifications.

  • Skill Profile: Allows developers to craft detailed bios, link professional profiles, and display skill badges and role certifications.

  • AI Assistant: Provides socratic tutoring for enhanced learning during practice assessments.

Employer Portal:

  • Company Overview: A dashboard that outlines certified developer strength, upskilling trends and skills distribution across the organization.

  • Talent Directory: Filters and organizes developer talent by verified skills.
  • Assign Tasks: Aids in the assignment of role certifications and skill badges for developer growth.

  • Administrative Tools: Streamlines the process for inviting and onboarding new employees, with an emphasis on role-specific categorization.

New Product: Engage

Engage helps you promote your tech brand to developers in the language they understand – coding events & hackathons. With its AI-driven technology, Engage enables organizations to:

  • Attract tech talent: Engage's AI co-pilot sets up event microsites to pull in registrations by highlighting your tech brand.

  • Host real-world challenges: Engage provides challenges that closely resemble the industry problems developers intend to solve.

  • Manage candidate relationships: Engage ensures that candidates are kept warm through meaningful and personalized engagements.

To understand more about the Engage product, see the Engage support article.

articles.name: HackerRank SkillUp
articles.title: HackerRank SkillUp
articles.body:
Introduction To SkillUp

SkillUp is a skills development solution for internal upskilling and internal mobility. Individuals identify current skills proficiency and are provided a learning plan for skill development for their existing role or a future role. Skill development is verified through successful completion of skill assessments and role certifications. For the organization, SkillUp provides a skills inventory of the developer org to identify strengths, gaps, and inform workforce planning.

SkillUp Use Cases

By creating visibility into your developer talent's current and future state, SkillUp helps create value for your organization and your developers by enabling data-driven development. 

Here is how it works: 

For Employers:

  • Workforce Planning: Gain insights into your organization's distribution of skills and roles. This data-driven approach allows you to understand your workforce's strengths and gaps, driving the success of your upskilling initiatives.
  • Talent Assessment: Accurately assess the current skill levels of your technical workforce using SkillUp's data-driven approach, eliminating guesswork and assumptions for informed decision-making.
  • Learning and Development Tracking: Utilize comprehensive reporting and analytics tools to track the progress and effectiveness of your learning and development initiatives. Monitor the impact of your efforts and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement.
  • Internal Mobility: Facilitate internal career paths and job moves for your technical talent by identifying potential candidates based on their verified skill profiles and development progress. This feature can reduce attrition and promote career advancement opportunities within your organization.

For Developers:

  • Upskilling Resources: Access a vast library of learning materials, including courses, tutorials, and hands-on projects, to enhance your skills across various roles and technologies. These resources are tailored to help you upskill and continuously benchmark your proficiencies.
  • Verified Skill Profiles: Create and maintain a verified skill profile on SkillUp. This profile showcases your proficiencies, achievements, and technical expertise, providing a comprehensive overview of your skills.
  • Curated Learning Resources : Based on your current skill level, career goals, and your organization's needs, SkillUp can recommend customized learning paths. These paths ensure efficient and targeted skill development, aligning your growth with organizational requirements.

By leveraging SkillUp, developers can take control of their skill development, earn credentials, and explore internal mobility opportunities. Simultaneously, employers can make informed decisions about their technical talent, drive upskilling initiatives, and ensure a skilled and productive workforce aligned with business objectives.

Accessing Employer Platform

This portal is designed for employers to access all the skill-level data in their organization in one place. 

Log in to your HackerRank account, click on Hire from the top menu, and select SkillUp from the dropdown menu.   

The Employer side of the SkillUp platform has two pages: 

Overview

Here, you can see a graphical representation of your organization's certified roles and skills.  

Main components: 

  • Company Overview: This graph gives you a clear view of your developer's funnel. It tracks the number of developers onboarded, assessed, and certified on the platform.
  • Certificate Distribution: This graph breaks down the distribution of the certified employees in each certification.
  • Certification Trends: This graph provides the trend of certifications over a period of time. You can filter by choosing certifications and timelines. 
  • Skill Distribution: This graph provides the skill level distribution of experts, intermediates, and beginners in each skill. You can filter by all skills or the skills you want by using the skills filter provided in the top right corner of the dashboard.

Talent

The talent directory organizes every developer in your organization based on their Designation, Certifications, and Skills proficiency. It helps you identify the individuals who best match a particular skill you seek. 

  • You can use the filters placed at the top to filter the employees based on their Job titles, certifications, skills, and managers.  
  • You can export this data by clicking the Export List button.
  • You can select any employee from the list and send them invitations for the certification or a skill badge test.

User Management

The User Management section on the employer platform allows you to access all the users in your organization from one place. 

  • To access the User Management page, click the profile icon and select the User Management option.  
  • You can now access all the users in your organization along with the filtering options.
  • To add a user, click on Add New Users.  
  • There are two types of users, Individual and Organization. Select the desired license you want to provide the user and click Send Invite.
  • You can also download the user data in bulk using the download option. 

Accessing Employee Platform  

The employee platform is segregated into three tabs: 

Home

On the home page, you can see two sections: 

My Career

This section shows you the certificates you have earned and tracks your progress toward your next certification goal. To view each role's certificate and progress details, utilize the slider component to scroll through them. Monitoring this section empowers you to take ownership of your learning path.

Assigned to Me

This section shows the additional certifications your leadership team suggested for you. Utilize this tailored guidance to open up new skills-development opportunities aligned with organizational needs. Tracking these recommendations allows you to see areas where growing your capabilities can stretch your impact.

  

Skills Directory

This directory enables you to explore in-demand skills to acquire. You can view globally trending abilities and all the skills available in HackerRank's library, organized by categories such as AI & ML, Software Engineering, Cloud Engineering, Data Engineering, and more. Tracking skills here provide visibility into those that align with organizational needs and can grow your impact.

As you select skills of interest, you can choose the proficiency level you want to target among Beginner, Intermediate, and Expert. You can access the concepts covered in the recommended learning resources. 

Practice Assessment

  • To test your skills, you can use the Practice Assessments. These untimed tests provide a safe environment to hone your coding skills without consequences. Only you can access the results of these assessments. 
  • There is no limit to these assessments; you can keep practicing until you are sure about taking an actual assessment .
  • In your practice assessments, you'll have access to an AI Tutor Bot in the form of a Socratic tutor. This assistant is designed to help you learn and understand new skills as you work through real-world coding challenges. The AI assistant can:
    • Explain the problem statement and requirements
    • Debug your code and point out errors or inefficiencies
    • Suggest alternative solutions or approaches
    • Answer questions and guide the way 

Earning Proficiency Badge

You can take the skill proficiency assessment once you are ready to assess your skill. These assessments help you evaluate your expertise in a specific area. 

Select the proficiency level and click on the Earn Badge. This will take you to the test environment.  

Roles Directory

This directory empowers you to explore organizational roles that match your skills. View roles organized by category where you can earn certifications based on your capabilities. Assess your readiness for each role while understanding the required skills and certification details. Tracking this directory provides visibility into areas where focused development can strengthen your impact and eligibility for new responsibilities over time. 

You can click on the desired role to look for the required skill proficiency. The graph at the bottom of the page compares your current and required skill levels to help you understand the areas to focus on. If you have all the necessary skills for a role, you can take the certification test and add it to your profile. 

Earning Certification

Role certification assessments lead to professional credentials certified by SkillUp, validating your knowledge and competency in a particular role. Earning these certifications showcases your readiness for specific job roles and responsibilities. When you have all the prerequisites unlocked you can take the assessment by clicking on the Take the Certification button. 

Once you have earned the certification it will show up on your profile with the date you earned it. 

My Profile

Your profile is the equivalent of a resume, where you can write your bio and provide your social links such as LinkedIn, Github, Stack Overflow, Twitter, or a personal website. The certifications you have completed and skill badges you have attained will appear here.  

To access your profile, click on the name in the top right corner and select My Profile.  

Frequently Asked Questions

How is a proficiency level determined?

Skill Ratings determine the proficiency level. HackerRank determines the cut-offs for each proficiency in a skill-based on inputs from SMEs and how the top 10% of the employees have scored in a particular assessment that determines the skill proficiency.

In the case of custom assessments (tailored to meet organization's requirements), the organizations set the cut-offs.

What if I take multiple assessments that assess the same skill?

The Skill Rating would be based on the results from the most recent assessment taken. This will help us keep the Skill Rating accurate and up-to-date to enable your decision-making process.

 

How can I access past Skill Ratings?

In the profile of an employee, you can go to the Skill Details section to see the progress of Skill Ratings over a period of time.

 

How many retakes are allowed for an assessment?

The employer will determine the number of retakes for each assessment based on their policies.

The cool-down period is determined as the days to pass before taking the next retake. 

 

What is the difference between Skill Ratings and Badges?

Skill Rating is a quantitative indicator of an individual's proficiency in technical skills.

Badges, on the other hand, are a way of acknowledging an achievement or a skill acquisition at a skill proficiency level. You can receive a badge when you have taken an assessment and reached proficiency level.

For example, If you take a Java assessment and achieve the required Skill Rating for expert proficiency, you will receive the Java (Expert) ^ badge.

 

What happens to my skill rating if the assessment is retired or updated?

An assessment is considered retired if it is deleted from HRW. You will continue to see the assessment scores in the Assessment History, but your Skill Rating will reflect the most recent Rating before the retired assessment.

An assessment is considered updated if the content of the assessment is changed. Your Skill Rating will not be affected if an assessment is updated.

 

How can I add custom learning resources to SkillUp?

You must provide an Excel sheet with the links to custom learning resources like Pluralsight videos or Udacity courses. Within two business days, the HackerRank team will manually add these links to the relevant skills. In the future, you can add custom resources through the admin dashboard.

 

Can I influence the content in certification assessments? 

No, you cannot influence or customize the content in the certification assessments. Hackerrank is taking a strategic bet on AI-first learning and will invest in providing guided, immersive AI tutors for each skill and role. The certification content will be Hackerrank's proprietary AI-powered assessments.

 

What is the difference between a badge and a certification? 

A badge is earned for demonstrating proficiency in a skill after passing a skill assessment. Certification is earned for a role that combines multiple skills after passing a comprehensive role assessment that includes prerequisites of earning the relevant skill badges.

 

Can I transfer skill badges earned outside the company (e.g., on the HackerRank community) to my employer's SkillUp account?

Currently, you cannot transfer external skill badges into your organization's SkillUp account. SkillUp treats personal community certifications separately from professional employer certifications to maintain data privacy and boundaries.

 

How often are the global in-demand skills updated on the SkillUp platform?

The global in-demand skills showcased on SkillUp are updated annually based on HackerRank's skills report research. However, the company is exploring increasing the frequency of these updates.

articles.name: HackerRank Engage
articles.title: HackerRank Engage
articles.body:
Overview

Companies are actively pursuing top-tier developers. Simultaneously, developers evaluate potential employers, focusing on key factors such as the kind of problems that the companies are working on, the tech stack they use to solve them, and their compensation.

However, the existing job descriptions and engagement tools presented below fall short of effectively highlighting these crucial aspects. HackerRank Engage offers a solution to address this challenge.

 

To view how to use Engage, see the article Get Started with Engage.

Why HackerRank Engage?

HackerRank Engage helps organizations create real-world hackathons or challenges to attract and nurture developers.

 

What are the Key Callouts of HackerRank Engage?    

The key callouts and benefits of HackerRank Engage are:

  • Build everything using AI

  • Customize every aspect of the event as per your liking 

  • Get candidates by publishing the microsite and getting candidates from your ATS and CRMs using the CSV upload capability. Reach out to the candidates through Scheduled Emails to register for the event.

  • Engage with candidates within your talent pool 

  • Set up your challenge and publish it for the participants

  • View the details of candidates on the Engage homepage 

  • Create a buzz about your brand by publishing the leaderboard (Leaderboard and Scheduled Email capability)

  • Scheduled Emails for sharing the achievement

Use Cases of Engage

Engage is ideal for Events focused on Hiring and Branding for early talent in India. For internal engagements, easily tailor your microsite by hiding irrelevant sections to align with your specific use case (for example, Testimonial and About Company sections). 

Engage Packages

The Engage product has two different offerings that you can choose from:

  1. Standard offering: This is a DIY offering that allows you to set up and run the Events on your own without any additional help from HackerRank. Ideal for cases where you have your own candidate pool and have your own outreach activities.

This offering requires you to have access to the Engage platform along with sufficient attempts so that you can run your Events.

  1. Managed: The managed offering is to augment the standard offering with additional services to make your Event more successful. It entails the below services that you can choose from based on your needs:
    • Custom content
    • Higher scale for Coding questions
    • Higher scale for Project questions 
    • Project Management effort (that includes the effort to set Ads on HackerRank Community and publishing a consolidated Event post on HackerRank’s social handles)
    • Custom changes to the microsite
    • Weekend support

As these are custom requests, we have a below timeline of activities that illustrates a picture of what to expect from the managed offering of Engage:

Interested in Engage?

If you are interested in learning more about Engage, just drop an email to engage-support@hackerrank.com and we will reach back to you in one business day.
